Here’s what is happening in and affecting South Africa today:
Coronavirus: In South Africa, there have been 1,853 new cases of Covid-19, taking the total reported to 3,679,539. Deaths have reached 9… [+3558 chars]

articles.author: Peter Fabricius
articles.title: BRICS — has South Africa caught a monster by the tail... - Daily Maverick
articles.description: It didn’t take a Nostrodamus to predict that South Africa might be biting off a bit more than it could chew when in 2011 it joined the BRICs (Brazil, Russia, India and China) to create the BRICS (in effect replacing the lower case ‘s’ with an upper case ‘S’).
articles.content: South Africa was from the start clearly a tiny Gulliver venturing into the land of the Brobdingnags. At the time, most commentators focused on the huge disparity in the size of South Africas economy … [+10293 chars]

articles.description: Cases tumble in Pakistan and Afghanistan, but African outbreaks have become a grave threat to eradication
articles.content: On 17 February, Malawis Ministry of Health announced a nasty surprise: A 3-year-old girl who was paralyzed in November 2021 was infected with the wild poliovirus, which Africa officially vanquished i… [+7708 chars]

articles.title: From cleaning boots to a maiden Test century: Why new Proteas star Erwee is 'a coach's dream' - News24
articles.description: Sarel Erwee has had to be patient, waiting for his opportunity to play Test cricket, but he is now set for an extended run at the top of the South African order.
articles.content:
• Proteas coach Mark Boucher is thrilled for Sarel Erwee, who took his Test chance against New Zealand.

articles.title: Russia's invasion of Ukraine: It's against SA's 'principles' to take sides, says deputy minister - News24
articles.description: With the civilian death toll in Ukraine rising after Russia invaded the country, South Africa will stick with its "principles" and not take sides, Deputy International Relations and Cooperation Minister Candith Mashego-Dlamini told the National Assembly.
